intro: Pradosia praealta var. subsessilis, commonly known as the slender pradosia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically ovate and have a soft, velvety texture. This species is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and greenhouses due to its attractive blooms and manageable growth habit.
